entry.title: Peoplesoft App Server Quick Trace On/Off
entry.content:
When you need to quickly turn tracing on/off on Peoplesoft App Server (Linux) you can use the following method:

  1. copy this file to a folder on App Server (make sure the app server user has access to the file ).

1. Modify the script specifying a location of the config file, and the tracing flags for SQL and peoplecode in APPSRVCFG, TRACESQL and TRACEPC respectively. 1. put the following line in your .bashrc (or another bash script that runs automatially):

. ./trace_alias.sh

Usage

  • To turn the tracing on:

    traceon

  • To see the current tracing settings:

    tracestat

  • To turn the tracing off:

    traceoff

entry.title: Fresh Start With GitHub Pages, Jekyll and Octopress
entry.content:
This is a place for me to share my attempts to figure out things. At this stage, I am trying to figure out publishing of blog pages using GitHub, Jekyll and Octopress.

I have done the first sample page but then realised that perhaps it needed an introduction. So here it is. Seems like a struggle, but I will get better at it. Kind of a leap from PeopleSoft to git, ruby and stuff. That said. I like it. Impressive how all this is working so well. Thank you all for the opportunity.
